alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Clinton; Fountain; Howard; Montgomery; Parke; Tippecanoe; Tipton; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 12:59PM EST until January 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and west central Indiana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
